title.value: The Impact of Educational Materials on Parental Anxiety and Productivity: A Clinical Trial in Pediatric Appendicitis
title.justification: The title clearly reflects the study's focus on evaluating educational materials' effects on parental anxiety and productivity in the context of pediatric appendicitis.
title.quote: The Impact of Educational Materials on Parental Anxiety and Productivity: A Clinical Trial in Pediatric Appendicitis

extractions.description: This paper discusses a clinical trial evaluating the effect of educational materials, specifically a pediatric appendicitis brochure, on parental anxiety and productivity. Conducted over two phases, parents' anxiety and productivity were assessed using structured scales and surveys. The trial aimed to determine if the educational intervention could decrease anxiety and improve productivity outcomes. However, while the brochure increased satisfaction, it did not mitigate anxiety levels or productivity loss, indicating the need for further research.

type.justification: The research involves an empirical study where a clinical trial was conducted to gather data and analyze the impact of educational materials on parental outcomes.
type.quote: We conducted a prospective study to assess the impact of educational materials on parents' anxiety and productivity during the child's illness.

name.justification: The study revolves around the surgical treatment and related family impacts in pediatric appendicitis cases, placing it squarely in the realm of Pediatric Surgery.
name.quote: Appendicitis is the most common acute surgical illness in children.

name.justification: The paper addresses the psychological impact of medical treatment information on stress and productivity, linking it to Health Psychology.
name.quote: Our hypothesis was that provision of this brochure would decrease preoperative anxiety and loss of productivity during the recovery period.

name.justification: The research emphasizes family-centered outcomes and interventions, tying it to this subfield.
name.quote: Defining the non-medical burden of the disease is an essential component of patient and family-centered care.
